org.kepler.gui

Interface PreferencesTab

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComponentLibraryPreferencesTab, EcogridPreferencesTab, KARPreferencesTab, SearchRegistryResultFrame, ServicesListModificationPanel, WorkflowRunEnginePreferenceTab, WorkflowSchedulerPreferenceTab

    public interface PreferencesTab
    This interface is to be implemented by anyone wanting to add a tab to the PreferencesFrame. The PreferencesTabFactory generates instances of PreferencesTab.
    Author:
    Aaron Schultz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getTabName()
      This method should return the name of the tab which is used to label the tab in the PreferencesFrame.
      void initializeTab()
      Initialization of the tab should be done at some point after the constructor is called.
      void onCancel()
      This method is called if the user presses the cancel button on the preferences frame.
      void onClose()
      This method is called as the preferences frame is closed legitimately meaning that all changes to the preferences should be saved.
      void setParent(TableauFrame frame)
      PreferencesTab usually will need access to the configuration of the Tableau that is opened in the BasicGraphFrame.

    • Method Detail

      • setParent

        void setParent(TableauFrame frame)
        PreferencesTab usually will need access to the configuration of the Tableau that is opened in the BasicGraphFrame. This method will be called before calling initializeTab.
        Parameters:
        config -

      • initializeTab

        void initializeTab()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialization of the tab should be done at some point after the constructor is called. The setConfiguration method is called before calling initializeTab() and this allows for easily adding new functions to this interface later on.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTabName

        java.lang.String getTabName()
        This method should return the name of the tab which is used to label the tab in the PreferencesFrame.

      • onClose

        void onClose()
        This method is called as the preferences frame is closed legitimately meaning that all changes to the preferences should be saved.

      • onCancel

        void onCancel()
        This method is called if the user presses the cancel button on the preferences frame. In this case all changes to the preferences should be ignored.
